segment.source: The Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) Client software enables administrators to enforce and monitor BitLocker Drive Encryption on computers in the enterprise.
segment.target: The Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) Client software enables administrators to enforce and monitor BitLocker Drive Encryption on computers in the enterprise.

segment.source: The BitLocker client can be integrated into an organization by deploying the client through an electronic software distribution system, such as Active Directory Domain Services, or by directly encrypting the client computers as part of the initial imaging process.
segment.target: The BitLocker client can be integrated into an organization by deploying the client through an electronic software distribution system, such as Active Directory Domain Services, or by directly encrypting the client computers as part of the initial imaging process.

segment.source: Depending on when you deploy the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Client software, you can enable BitLocker Drive Encryption on a computer in your organization either before the end user receives the computer or afterwards by configuring Group Policy and deploying the MBAM Client software by using an enterprise software deployment system.
segment.target: Depending on when you deploy the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Client software, you can enable BitLocker Drive Encryption on a computer in your organization either before the end user receives the computer or afterwards by configuring Group Policy and deploying the MBAM Client software by using an enterprise software deployment system.

segment.source: Deploy the MBAM Client to desktop or laptop computers
segment.target: Deploy the MBAM Client to desktop or laptop computers

segment.source: After configuring Group Policy settings, you can use an enterprise software deployment system product like Microsoft System Center 2012 Configuration Manager or Active Directory Domain Services to deploy the MBAM Client installation Windows Installer files to target computers.
segment.target: After configuring Group Policy settings, you can use an enterprise software deployment system product like Microsoft System Center 2012 Configuration Manager or Active Directory Domain Services to deploy the MBAM Client installation Windows Installer files to target computers.

segment.source: You can use either the 32-bit or 64-bit MbamClientSetup.exe files or the 32-bit or 64-bit MBAMClient.msi files, which are provided with the MBAM Client software.
segment.target: You can use either the 32-bit or 64-bit MbamClientSetup.exe files or the 32-bit or 64-bit MBAMClient.msi files, which are provided with the MBAM Client software.

segment.source: For more information about deploying MBAM Group Policy settings, see Deploying MBAM 2.5 Group Policy Objects.
segment.target: For more information about deploying MBAM Group Policy settings, see Deploying MBAM 2.5 Group Policy Objects.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Beginning in MBAM 2.5 SP1, a separate MSI is no longer included with the MBAM product.
segment.target: Beginning in MBAM 2.5 SP1, a separate MSI is no longer included with the MBAM product.

segment.source: However, you can extract the MSI from the executable file (.exe) that is included with the product.
segment.target: However, you can extract the MSI from the executable file (.exe) that is included with the product.

segment.source: Deploy the MBAM Client as part of a Windows deployment
segment.target: Deploy the MBAM Client as part of a Windows deployment

segment.source: In organizations where computers are received and configured centrally, you can install the MBAM Client to manage BitLocker Drive Encryption on each computer before any user data is written to it.
segment.target: In organizations where computers are received and configured centrally, you can install the MBAM Client to manage BitLocker Drive Encryption on each computer before any user data is written to it.

segment.source: The benefit of this process is that every computer is then BitLocker Drive Encryption-compliant.
segment.target: The benefit of this process is that every computer is then BitLocker Drive Encryption-compliant.

segment.source: This method does not rely on user action because the administrator has already encrypted the computer.
segment.target: This method does not rely on user action because the administrator has already encrypted the computer.

segment.source: A key assumption for this scenario is that the policy of the organization installs a corporate Windows image before the computer is delivered to the user.
segment.target: A key assumption for this scenario is that the policy of the organization installs a corporate Windows image before the computer is delivered to the user.

segment.source: If the Group Policy settings has been configured to require a PIN, users are prompted to set a PIN after they receive the policy.
segment.target: If the Group Policy settings has been configured to require a PIN, users are prompted to set a PIN after they receive the policy.
